## Figures



```{r, fig.show='hold'}

  library(ggplot2)
  library(rxtheme)
  library(trendyy)
  library(tidyverse)
    
# get some google trend data
    q <- c("Bob", "Margot" ,"Marc")
    q_trends <- trendy(q, from = "2019-03-01", to = Sys.Date())
    
# visualize data with all defaults
    q_trends %>% 
    get_interest() %>% 
    ggplot(aes(date, hits, color = keyword)) +
    geom_line() +
    geom_point(alpha = .5) +
    theme_rx() + # apply 
    scale_color_rx()+
    scale_fill_rx()+
    labs(x = "Time", 
         y = "Relative Search Popularity",
         title = "")
    
    

    

```

## Using a different palette

RevelX has a number of predefined palletes


```{r}
# using a different predefined pallete
   q_trends %>% 
    get_interest() %>% 
    ggplot(aes(date, 
               hits, 
               fill = keyword)) +
    geom_bar( stat="identity" ) +
    theme_rx() + # apply 
    scale_fill_rx( palette = "marc", reverse = T)+
    labs(x = "Time", 
         y = "Relative Search Popularity",
         title = "")
```
